casebody.data:
Wade A. MALONE, Plaintiff-Appellant, v. FORD, Mr., Nurse at Facility, Richmond City Jail; Infirmary Staff, Richmond City Jail, Defendants—Appellees. No. 07-7395. United States Court of Appeals, Fourth Circuit. Submitted: Jan. 17, 2008. Decided: Jan. 28, 2008. Wade A. Malone, Appellant Pro Se. Thomas D. Lane, Tiller Law Group, Richmond, Virginia, for Appellee Ford. Before TRAXLER, SHEDD, and DUNCAN, Circuit Judges.

Affirmed by unpublished PER CURIAM opinion.

Unpublished opinions are not binding precedent in this circuit.

PER CURIAM:

Wade A. Malone appeals the district court’s order denying relief on his 42 U.S.C. § 1983 (2000) complaint. We have reviewed the record and find no reversible error. Accordingly, we affirm for the reasons stated by the district court. Malone v. Ford, No. 3:06-cv-00500-RLW (E.D.Va. Aug. 24, 2007). We dispense with oral argument because the facts and legal contentions are adequately presented in the *538materials before the court and argument would not aid the decisional process.

AFFIRMED.
